Art Exhibition Opens 
    Kaesong, July 7 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of portraits of anti-Japanese revolutionary comrades-in-arms of President   Kim Il Sung and related persons mentioned in his reminiscences "With the Century" was opened at the Kaesong Art Gallery Wednesday on the occasion of the 11th anniversary of his demise. 
 On display there are a painting depicting Kim Il Sung visiting the old home of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu after writing his reminiscences, an immortal library, and those portraying Kim Jong Il among servicepersons and Anti-Japanese War Hero Kim Jong Suk.    
 Also on display there are more than 90 portraits of Cha Kwang Su, Kim Hyok, Kim Chaek and others who are still remembered by the Korean people as soldiers loyal to their leader thanks to the noble comradeship of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
